qas.question: What gun are FBI special agents issued?

answers.text: Glock Model 22 pistol or a Glock 23 in .40 S&W caliber

qas.question: What are FBI special agents issued if they fail their first qualification?
What did the FBI adopt in May 1997
What did the FBI adopt the Glock .40 S&W pistol for?
What class was the first to receive the Glock .40 S&W pistol?

plausible_answers.text: Glock Model 22 pistol or a Glock 23 in .40 S&W caliber

qas.question: What gun are CIA agents issued?
What gun are FBI agents issued if they fail their second qualification?
What gun did the FBI use before 1997?
What gun are special agents not authorized to carry?
What gun are regional SWAT teams barred from using?

context: An FBI special agent is issued a <a0_0><b5_0>Glock Model 22 pistol or a Glock 23 in .40 S&W caliber<b5_0/><a0_0/>. If they fail their first qualification, they are issued either a <a1_0><b6_0>Glock 17 or Glock 19<b6_0/><a1_0/>, to aid in their next qualification. In May 1997, the FBI officially adopted the <a2_0><b7_0>Glock .40 S&W pistol<b7_0/><a2_0/> for <a3_0>general agent use<a3_0/> and first issued it to <a4_0>New Agent Class 98-1<a4_0/> in October 1997. At present, the Model 23 "FG&R" (finger groove and rail) is the issue sidearm. New agents are issued firearms, on which they must qualify, on successful completion of their training at the FBI Academy. The Glock 26 in 9×19mm Parabellum, and Glock Models 23 and 27 in .40 S&W caliber are authorized as secondary weapons. Special agents are authorized to purchase and qualify with the <b8_0>Glock Model 21 in .45 ACP<b8_0/>. Special agents of the FBI HRT (Hostage Rescue Team), and regional SWAT teams are issued the <b9_0>Springfield Professional Model 1911A1 .45 ACP pistol<b9_0/> (see FBI Special Weapons and Tactics Teams).
